meta.content: Brooke is a network of high-performing public charter schools in Boston with a mission is to provide an academically rigorous public education that ensures students are prepared to succeed in college and beyond.

div.p: In line with Governor Baker’s decision, Brooke Charter Schools will not reopen for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We will do everything we can to provide the high-quality education our scholars deserve. Principals will share more detailed information with families over the coming days and weeks.

div.h4: During this difficult time, we are focused on Supporting

div.p: Our COVID-19 Resources page holds school communication updates and resources to support our families while schools are closed and scholars are learning at home. This page includes information about meal pick-up locations across Boston, getting set up with technology at home, mental and physical wellness, and much more.

Although our school buildings are closed, we are still hiring Associate Teachers and lead teachers for the 2020-2021 school year. We are actively accepting applications, conducting virtual interviews, and holding virtual information sessions. Review our open positions and submit your application before May 1st priority deadline.

With schools closed and all learning taking place at home, our partnership with families is more important than ever. We are raising money to directly support Brooke families hit hardest by COVID-19-related illness or job loss. If you're able to make a donation, our closest donors have volunteered to match your gift. Families who need support will get information from their schools about how to apply.

As soon as we understood schools needed to close, our amazing principals and teachers immediately began executing distance learning initiatives. You can catch up on our activities this year as well as our transition to distance learning on the Brooke Stories page.

div.h4: Zoom Into a Virtual Classroom For
div.h1: Examples of Distance Learning with Brooke Teachers

figcaption.p: Ms. Pearson leads her kindergarten scholars through a word study lesson filled with counting syllables, identifying sight words, and blending words.
Mr. Scott reads a new story and demonstrates strategies for answering critical reading questions in this English language arts (ELA) lesson.
Ms. Stacker and the LSU sixth grade scholars explore statistical questions in a live Google classroom lesson.

div.p: I can't help but feel so PROUD of the community my son is part of! I love that his teacher has tried to keep students connected with their peers in these times of isolation making sure they feel connected!

div.h4: Visit Our School Pages to Learn More About

figcaption.p: Brooke High School currently serves over 390 students in grades nine through twelve and will graduate it's first class of seniors in 2020.
Brooke Roslindale currently serves over 480 students in grades kindergarten through seven with the motto: Engage together, grow together, achieve together.
Brooke Mattapan currently serves over 480 students in grades kindergarten through seven as is committed to achieving exceptional results for scholars.
Brooke East Boston currently serves over 480 students in grades kindergarten through seven with the motto: Building a community of care.
Brooke's Eighth Grade Academy prepares over 150 eighth grade students to succeed socially and academically in Brooke High School and beyond.
